_header: For health of body cover for cold thine head
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 420; Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 415.5; sometimes preceded by three stanzas: see 6586; for a disarranged and defective version see 2369.

BodAddB60.First Lines:
FOr helthe of body covyr fro colde thyne hedeEte no rawe mete take
                    good hede ther toDrynke holsome wyne fede the on liȝt bredeWith
                    an appetite rise fro thy mete also…
BodAddB60.Last Lines:
…Of maister Antonye ne of maister HeweTo all in deferente
                    richeste dyatary

BodAsh61.First Lines:
ffor helth of body couer fro cold þi hedeEte non raw mete take
                    gode hede þer toDrynke holsom drynke fede þe on lyȝht
                    bredeAnd with Apytyte ryse fro þi mete also…
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…Off mayster Antony ne of master hewTo all deferent it is
                    dyatary
BodAsh61.Attributed Title:
The gouernans of man (f. 107); Explicet the gouernans of man (f.
                    108)
BodAsh61.Editions:
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 277-9; 528-31; 615.

Bod48.First Lines:
ffor helth of bodie cover for cold thine hedeEt no raw mete take
                    gode hede her to…
Bod48.Last Lines:
…Off maister Antonye no of maister heweTo al indifferent
                    richest dietarie

Bod686.First Lines:
For helth of body kover for colde þin hedeEte no rawe mete
                    take gode hede herto…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Of maister Antony nor of maister hughTo all indifferent
                    Rihest dietarie
Bod686.Attributed Author: Dan Iohn lydgate Monke of Bury (f. 187v)
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth a neodful Tretis for mannes helthe of his body compiled and
                    made compen in Balade be Dan Iohn lydgate Monke of Bury (f.
                    187v)

Bod912.First Lines:
For helthe of body keuer fro cold thyn hedeEte no rawe mete take
                    gode hede her too…
Bod912.Last Lines:
…Cloos of tong of wurd not disseynableTo sey the best sette al
                    way þy plesauns

BodeMus52.First Lines:
ffor helth of body keuer fro colde þyn hedeEtte no raw mete
                    take goode heede þerto…
BodeMus52.Last Lines:
…Off Mayster Antony nor of mayster hewth To all Indefferent
                    rychest dyatory

BodLatTheD15.First Lines:
FOr healthe of bodie Cover from Colde thy headeEatt no raw meytt
                    tayke good heyde herto…
BodLatTheD15.Last Lines:
…of mayster Anthony ne of mayster heweto all In differentt
                    Richest dierari

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
For helt[h] of body kepe fro cold thyn hedete no[ ]auh mete take
                    good heed her too…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…of master antonye ne of master hughto alle in dyfferent
                    richest dyetarye
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: Here begynn[ ]th a doctryne of ffesyk (f. 60)

[F]or helth of body covoure from colde thi hedeete no rawe mete

CamFitz261.First Lines:
FOr helthe of body couere for colde thyn hedeEte n Rawe mete take
                    goode hyde therto…
CamFitz261.Last Lines:
…This Receyte bought ys of no potikaryOf maister Antony nother
                    of maister hughTo all Indifferent most Rychest dietarie
CamFitz261.Attributed Title: Here foloweth the most Riche dietarie (f. 30v)

CamJes56.First Lines:
For helth of body couer fro colde þine hedeEte no rawe mete
                    take good hede þeire to…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…Of master Antony ne of master heweTo all indifferent richest
                    dietarie
CamJes56.Note: Follows immediately after 6586, as if part of same text.

CamStJohn191.First Lines:
for heill of thy body kep wele fra cald þi hedeEte no raw met
                    tak gude heid þar to…
CamStJohn191.Last Lines:

                    is dyetry

CamTCC263.First Lines:
For helth of body kepe fro colde thyn hedEte no rawe mete take good
                    hede there to…
CamTCC263.Last Lines:
…Of mastyre Antony noþer of mastyr heweTo alle
                    yndyfferent this is þe rychyst dyetary
CamTCC263.Attributed Title:
Dietarium locarium & itinerarium Si tibi deficiant medici tibi fiant
                        Hec tria mens leta labor moderata dieta (f. 26v)

CamTCC1117.First Lines:
ffor heyth of body couer for cold thy hedeEytt no rew meytt take
                    good heed þer to…
CamTCC1117.Last Lines:
…Of meyse antony ne of [meykell?]Bott al in different
                    [þicknys?] dyete

BLAdd10099.First Lines:
ffor helthe of body couer forfrocalde thy
                    hedeEte no Rawe mete take goode hede herto…
BLAdd10099.Last Lines:
…Of maister Antony ne of maister heweTo all indifferent
                    richest dietarye

BLAdd11307.First Lines:
Fore helth of body couer fro colde thyne
                    hedeEte no raw mete, take goode heede ther
                    too…
BLAdd11307.Last Lines:
…And all sayntes reioisynge in the trynyteBrynge vs to that hy
                    glorious towre amen fore cheryte
BLAdd11307.Note:
Four-line stanzas, abab. Text is a nineteenth-century copy. Crossings
                    out made by later hand in pencil.
BLAdd11307.Attributed Title:
A Diatorie (f. 126); Of three poems copied from another MS (title page, f.
                    1, nineteenth-century hand)

BLAdd31042.First Lines: …Be noghte hasty nore sodanly vengeableTo pore folkes doo no violence…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …Of Maister Antonye ne of mayster hugheTo alle indeferent recheste dyetarye

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
[F]Or helth of body couer for cold thyn hedeEte no raw mete take
                    goode hede therto…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…Of Maister Antony nor of mayster heweTo al indifferent
                    Richest diaterye

BLAru168.First Lines:
ffor helth of body cover from cold þine hedeEte no rawe mete
                    take goode hede therto…
BLAru168.Last Lines:
…Neuer gruchynge mery like thi degreIf Phisik lakk make
                    þis þi gouernaunce
BLAru168.Note:
Two stanzas only here; begins with 6 lines of Latin as heading (ff.
                        14rb-14va).

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
ffor helth of bydy couer for cold þy heedEte no rawe mete take
                    good hede þer to…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Of maystyre Antonye nor of mayster hueBut to all yndyfferent
                    rychest dyatarye
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Begins f. 15v without a break after 3588, as if one work; only 9 stanzas in
                    this MS; ‘Explycit’ in lower margin f. 16v.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Another old poeme of good aduise (f. 1, sixteenth=century list of contents,
                    encompassing 3588 as well)

BLCottTitDXX.First Lines:
…With iij folke be not at debateffirst with thi better be
                    ware for to stryve…
BLCottTitDXX.Last Lines:
…Of master antony ne of master heweTo all indifferent riches
                    dyatory

BLEge1995.First Lines:
Fyrste for helthe of boody couyr for colde thyne heddeEte noo rawe
                    mete take good hede þer too…
BLEge1995.Last Lines:
…Of mayster harry ne of mayster heweTo alle indyfference
                    rychyste ys in hys dyatary

BLHar541.First Lines: or helth of body from colde kepe thyn hedThi stomak also take gode hede therto…
BLHar541.Last Lines: …ffor thingis contrary to ther ComplecciounOf gredy hondis the stomach hath gret peyn…
BLHar541.Note: F. 210 misplaced so this text on 209v, 211, and 211v; only 9 stanzas in this MS.

BLHar941.First Lines: For helth of þi body keuer frome cold þi hedEte no raw mete take gode hede þerto…
BLHar941.Last Lines: …Of mayster antony ne of mayster hughTo Indifferent rychest & detari
BLHar941.Attributed Title: Explicit concilium corporis & anime; Explicit dietarye particlare (f. 25)

BLHar2252.First Lines:
For helthe of Bodye kepe from cold thyne hedeEte no Rawe mete Take
                    good hede therto…
BLHar2252.Last Lines:
…Of All Welfare prossperyte and ffoysonAnd with thy neybors
                    love in Reste & pese

BLHar4011.First Lines:
FOr helthe of body Kepe well thyn hedeEte no rawe mete take good
                    hede therto…
BLHar4011.Last Lines:
…After mete beware also make no longe slepeHede foote and
                    stomak preserve ay fro colde…
BLHar4011.Note:
Lines 1-58; Ends incomplete, just single leaf written on both
                    sides.

BLHar5401.First Lines:
Couer allway fro cold þyn hedeEte no raw mete take gode hede
                    þer to…
BLHar5401.Last Lines:
…Afftyr þi rent mayntene þyn howsoldeSuffer in tyme
                    of ryght be balde
BLHar5401.Note:
Folio number reflects the most recent foliation. Lines
                    1-61.

Banna.First Lines:
For helth of body couer weill thy heidEit nocht raw meit thow tak
                    gud tent þerto…

…off maister antone nor of maister hewTill all neidrent
                    richest detray the

NLS23711.Transcription:
ffor helth off thy body kever for colde thy hedeEte no rawe mete take
                    gude hede her toDrynke smale drynke ffede þe on Lyȝht
                    bredeWith An apytyde Ryse ffrom thy mete allsoWyth women fflechely
                    have not to doVppon thy Slepe drynke not of the copeGlade to bede at
                    morou vp allsoAnd vse neuer late to Ete ne soppe
NLS23711.Note:
One eight-line stanza only, set out as 2 quatrains; added to flyleaf
                    with pentrials.

EDU205.First Lines:
ffor hail of body keip fra cald þy heideit na raw meit tak gud
                    heid þer to…
EDU205.Last Lines:
…Of master Antone na ȝit of master hewto feret Rycheast
                    dyatry
EDU205.Editions:
Stevenson,  George. 
             Pieces from the Makculloch and the Gray MSS. together with The Chepman
                and Myllar Prints.
Scottish Text Society
         65. Edinburgh, 1918: 30-2.

GULHun259.First Lines:
For helthe of þe body couere for colde þyn
                    hedeete no rawe mete take good heed therto…
GULHun259.Last Lines:
…Of maister Anthony nor of maister harryto alle indifferent
                    richest dietary

Lam444.First Lines:
ffor helth of body couere for colde thi heedEte no raw mete take
                    good heed þerto…
Lam444.Last Lines:
…Of maister antonye noþer of maister heweto all
                    indefferent richest dyatorye

SocAnt101.First Lines:
ffor helth of Body from colde kepe your stomak & hedeEte no Raw
                    mete take good heede thertoDrynk holsom drynk ffede yow with litill
                    bredeAnd with an Apetit rise from your mete also…
SocAnt101.Last Lines:
…Euermore charite to your soul is dueThis Recept is bought of
                    no poticaryOf Maister Antony nor of Maist[er?] heughBut of al tho
                    þat wil vse this letuaryExplicit
SocAnt101.Note:
Shifts from single column format on the recto to double on the
                    verso.

Wellcome406.Transcription:
ffor helth of bodye couer from cold þi hedeEate no Raw mete take
                    good hede there todrincke holsom drincke fede on light breadwith an
                    appetit Rise frome the meatAlso with wemen aged[?] have tho not to
                    dow

Wellcome411.First Lines:
ffor helþe of body couere from cold þyn hedeEte no rawe
                    mete take good hede to lyght brede…
Wellcome411.Last Lines:
of mayster Antonye nor of mayster heweof al in dyfferent resseytes
                    hit most salutarye

ffor helth of body couer fro colde þine hedeEte no raw mete

TCD516.First Lines:
For helth of body couere for colde thyn hedeEte no raw mete take
                    good hede herto…
TCD516.Last Lines:
…fro thynges contraire to here complexionOf gredy handis the

TCD537.First Lines:
for health of bodye cover fro cold thy headetake no raw meates take
                    good heede hereto…
TCD537.Last Lines:
…firste with thy better beware for the stryveagaynste thy
                    fellowe no quarell to contryve
TCD537.Note: four stanzas plus five lines; ends imperfectly.

Lille.First Lines: For helth of body kepe wel thyn hedEyte no raw meyte takeand hede thereto…
Lille.Last Lines: …Of mayster antony nor of mayster heweOff al indiferent the richest dietare

Schwerdt.First Lines:
[F]or helthe of body covir fro colde thyne hedeEte no rawe mete
                    take good hede þertoDrynke holsome wyne fede þe on liȝt
                    bredeWith an appetite rise fro thi mere also…
Schwerdt.Last Lines:
…This reseyte is bowȝt of no poticaryeOf maister Antonye
                    ne of maister heweTo all in deferente richeste
                    dyatary.Explicit
Schwerdt.Note:
Below, a later owner has added: ‘This Treatize is almost
                    unintelligible 1828’. Our thanks to Prof. David Scott-Macnab of the
                    University of Johannesburg for providing the transcription.
